Sentencas: SmxCa0.2-xCe0.8Oy materials are synthesized by changing mol ratios of the composition as x = 0, 0.05, 0.1, 0.15 and 0.2, respectively, with a fast and facile cellulose templating method for the first time.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ca-Sm-Ce mixed oxides via cellulose templating method for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Microstructures of the calcined and sintered samples are characterized by XRD and SEM-EDX.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ca-Sm-Ce mixed oxides via cellulose templating method for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Density measurements are actualized by using Archimedes method.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ca-Sm-Ce mixed oxides via cellulose templating method for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The electrical conductivity of the samples is obtained from two-probe impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ca-Sm-Ce mixed oxides via cellulose templating method for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Maximum solubility limit of CaO in CeO2 is found to be 9.4 mol% from the XRD results.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ca-Sm-Ce mixed oxides via cellulose templating method for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Incorporation of CaO slightly increases the sinterability of the samples.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ca-Sm-Ce mixed oxides via cellulose templating method for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: It is observed that Sm+3 expands the CeO2 lattice more than Ca+2. 10 mol% CaO incorporated sample show the highest total conductivity with the value of 0.032 S cm(-1) at 800 degrees C. Obtained results show that Sm0.1Ca0.1Ce0.8Oy can be an excellent candidate for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell applications due to its lower cost and higher performance compared to Sm0.2Ce0.8Oy at 800 degrees C. Additionally, cellulose templating method can be used as an effective method in order to prepare mixed oxide structures since the performances of the samples are higher than the samples which are prepared by more complex or costly hydrothermal and co-precipitation methods in literature.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ca-Sm-Ce mixed oxides via cellulose templating method for solid oxide fuel cell applications
Preparation and characterization of Ca-Sm-Ce mixed oxides via cellulose templating method for solid oxide fuel cell applications
Preparation and characterization of Ca-Sm-Ce mixed oxides via cellulose templating method for solid oxide fuel cell applications
